com.codecool.mindreader

Class MindReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codecool.mindreader.MindReader

  • public class MindReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes the number of digits (numberOfDigits) from the user, and returns with a random number, then asks the user, how many digits is in correct place. The user can only input this one parameter, and the program tries to find the guessed number.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MindReader(int numberOfDigits)

      This method generates a new random Number, and compares with the previous number.

      This is the main method of the program.

      This method generates a new int digit 0-9 or 1-9, depending from the given index parameter.
      Number newNumber()
      This method generates new Number from random digits.
      void newTurn()
      This method runs until the program finds the guessed number.
      void setup()
      This method generates a new random number, and stores as Number type.
      int userInput()
      This method takes the number of correct digits from the user.

      • MindReader

        public MindReader(int numberOfDigits)

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup()
        This method generates a new random number, and stores as Number type.

      • newTurn

        public void newTurn()
        This method runs until the program finds the guessed number.

      • compareNumbers

        public void compareNumbers()
        This method generates a new random Number, and compares with the previous number. If the number of correct digits greater than previously, it sets the new number as the new guessed number.

      • newNumber

        public Number newNumber()
        This method generates new Number from random digits.
        Returns:
        Returns with the generated Number.

      • newDigit

        public int newDigit(int index)
        This method generates a new int digit 0-9 or 1-9, depending from the given index parameter.
        Parameters:
        index - If index is zero (first digit of the number), the new digit is 1-9, otherwise is 0-9.
        Returns:
        Returns with the generated digit.

      • userInput

        public int userInput()
        This method takes the number of correct digits from the user.
        Returns:
        Returns with the integer user input.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method of the program.
        Parameters:
        args - List of arguments.
